    field1 => string (1230) "<b><u>As a minimum</u></b>, does the statement of financial position include...
    $value[1]['field1']
    <b><u>As a minimum</u></b>, does the statement of financial position include line items that present:
<ol type="a">
    <li>Property, plant and equipment;</li>
    <li>Investment property;</li>
    <li>Intangible assets;</li>
    <li>Financial assets (excluding amounts shown under e., h, and i);</li>
    <li>Investments accounted for using the equity method;</li>
    <li>Biological assets;</li>
    <li>Inventories;</li>
    <li>Trade and other receivables;</li>
    <li>Cash and cash equivalents;</li>
    <li>The total of assets classified as held for sale and assets included in disposal groups classified as held for resale in accordance with IFRS 5;</li>
    <li>Trade and other payables;</li>
    <li>Provisions;</li>
    <li>Financial liabilities (excluding amounts shown under k. and l.)</li>
    <li>Liabilities and assets for current tax;</li>
    <li>Deferred tax liabilities and assets;</li>
    <li>Liabilities included in disposal groups classified as held for sale in accordance with IFRS 5;</li>
    <li>Issued capital and reserves attributable to owners of the parent.</li>
</ol>
<p>NB1: The Standard does not prescribe either the format or the order in which these items are presented.</p>

    $value[4]['field1']
    Irrespective of how the Statement of Financial Position is presented, has the entity disclosed the amount expected to be recovered or settled after more than 12 months for each asset and liability line item that combines amounts expected to be recovered or settled:
<ul>
    <li>No more than twelve months after the reporting period; and </li>
    <li>More than twelve months after the reporting period?</li>
</ul>
<p>Specific IFRS require extensive maturity disclosure regarding financial instruments (and thus there is some overlap in the requirements of the Standards), however, IAS 1.61 requires maturity analysis about all classifications, thus for example, provisions and stock would need the above analysis.</p>

    <p>An entity shall disclose, either on the face of the Statement of Financial Position or in the notes a suitable sub-classification of the line items presented in the Statement of Financial Position (i.e. a split of receivables into: trade, related party, prepayment and other).</p>
<p>IAS 1 gives examples only, and some specific Standards prescribe a minimum level of analysis (these issues have been specifically noted later in the checklist), however, management of the entity must consider whether the level of analysis is detailed enough to be meaningful.</p>
<p>Has an adequate level of analysis been given for Statement of Financial Position items?</p>

    Is the following reconciliation note disclosed for each class of intangible fixed assets noted above and distinguishing between internally generated intangibles and other intangibles?
<ul>
    <li>Aggregate cost / valuation at the beginning and end of the financial period;</li>
    <li>Additions, indicating separately those from internal development and those actually acquired;</li>
    <li>Acquisitions through businesses combinations;</li>
    <li>Assets now classified as held for sale or included in a disposal group classified as held for sale in accordance with IFRS 5;</li>
    <li>Other disposals;</li>
    <li>Increases and decreases in revaluation;</li>
    <li>Net exchange difference arising on the translation of the financial statement into the presentation currency, and on translation of a foreign operation into the presentation currency of the entity;</li>
    <li>Other changes;</li>
    <li>Aggregate cumulative amortisation / impairment losses at the beginning and end of  the period;</li>
    <li>Amortisation;</li>
    <li>Impairment losses recognised in the profit or loss;</li>
    <li>Impairment losses reversed in the profit or loss;</li>
    <li>Any adjustments as a result of disposals in the period;</li>
    <li>Assets now classified as held for sale or included in a disposal group classified as held for sale in accordance with IFRS 5; </li>
    <li>Other disposals;</li>
    <li>Net exchange differences arising on the translation of the financial statements into the presentation currency, and on translation of a foreign operation into the presentation currency of the entity;</li>
    <li>Other changes;</li>
    <li>Net carrying amount at the beginning and end of the period?</li>
</ul>
<p>NB: Full corresponding amounts <b><u>need</u></b> to be disclosed.</p>

    For accounting periods beginning <b><u>on or after 1 January 2018,</u></b> review paragraphs 57 and 58 of IAS 40 in relation to transfers of investment properties. These have been amended by <i>Transfers of Investment Property (Amendments to IAS 40).</i>

    field1 => string (1021) "<b>Investment Properties ~ Where the Fair Value Model has been Adopted</b> <...
    $value[40]['field1']
    <b>Investment Properties ~ Where the Fair Value Model has been Adopted</b>
<p>Is the following information disclosed:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Carrying value at the beginning and end of the financial period;</li>
    <li>Aggregate additions (showing separately additions arising from acquisitions, subsequent expenditure or as a result of a business combinations);</li>
    <li>Assets re-classified as held for sale or included in a disposal group classified as held for sale in accordance with IFRS 5 and other disposals;</li>
    <li>Net gains and losses from fair value adjustments;</li>
    <li>Net exchange differences;</li>
    <li>Transfers to and from inventories and owner-occupied properties (PPE); and</li>
    <li>Other changes?</li>
</ul>
<p>NB: Full corresponding amounts <b><u>need</u></b> to be disclosed.</p>
<p>NB: Where in <b><u>exceptional circumstances</u></b> some assets are held at cost, then the above analysis would need to be given for assets held at fair value and assets held at cost.</p>

    ⇄⧉
    field1 => string (1474) "<b>Investment Properties ~ Where the Cost Model has been Adopted</b> <p>Is t...
    $value[44]['field1']
    <b>Investment Properties ~ Where the Cost Model has been Adopted</b>
<p>Is the following reconciliation disclosed:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Aggregate cost at the beginning and end of the financial period;</li>
    <li>Aggregate additions (showing separately additions arising from acquisition, subsequent expenditure or as a result of a business combinations);</li>
    <li>Assets classified as held for sale or included in a disposal group as classified as held for sale in accordance with IFRS 5 or other disposals;</li>
    <li>Transfers to and from inventories and owner-occupied properties (PPE);</li>
    <li>Foreign exchange movements;</li>
    <li>Other changes.</li>
    <li>Aggregate cumulative depreciation / impairment losses at the beginning and end of the period;</li>
    <li>Depreciation;</li>
    <li>Impairment losses recognised in the profit or loss;</li>
    <li>Impairment losses or reversed in the profit or loss;</li>
    <li>Any adjustments as a result of assets being classified as held for sale or included in a disposal group as classified as held for sale in accordance with IFRS 5 or other disposals;</li>
    <li>Transfers to and from inventories and owner-occupied properties (PPE) due to change of usage;</li>
    <li>Foreign exchange movements;</li>
    <li>Other changes;</li>
    <li>Net carrying amount at the beginning and end of the period?</li>
</ul>
<p>NB: Full corresponding amounts <b><u>need</u></b> to be disclosed.</p>

    field1 => UTF-8 string (1088) "<b>IFRS 16 Leases</b> <p>IFRS 16 Leases is mandatory for accounting periods ...
    $value[60]['field1']
    <b>IFRS 16 Leases</b>
<p>IFRS 16 Leases is mandatory for accounting periods commencing on/after 1 January 2019. The disclosure requirements are more substantial than those previously required by IAS 17. </p>
<p>The disclosures required under IFRS 16 have been listed below in this section, rather than split between the SCI, Statement of Financial Position and Accounting Policies sections of the Checklist. It is considered that, in the circumstances of the significant additional disclosures required, it is more straightforward to provide the disclosure requirements in one section.</p>
<p>The disclosure requirements have been broken down as follows :</p>
<ul>
    <li>13 – Entity is a lessee</li>
    <li>14 – Entity is lessor: finance leases</li>
    <li>15 – Entity is a lessor: operating leases</li>
</ul>
<p><b>First time adoption of IFRS 16 will also require additional transitional disclosures; see question 5.2 of Section 8 – </b>“Accounting Policies and Estimation Techniques” <b>below. This will require completion of a supplementary checklist.</b> </p>

    field1 => UTF-8 string (1059) "Where necessary to meet the objective of providing users of the financial st...
    $value[71]['field1']
    Where necessary to meet the objective of providing users of the financial statements with sufficient information to assess the effect that leases have on the financial position, financial performance and cash flows of the lessee, has additional qualitative and quantitative information been disclosed? 
<p>This may include the following: </p>
<ul>
    <li>the nature of the lessee’s leasing activities;</li>
    <li>future cash outflows to which the lessee is potentially exposed that are not reflected in the measurement of lease liabilities. This includes exposure arising from:
        <ul>
            <li>variable lease payments;</li>
            <li>extension options and termination options;</li>
            <li>residual value guarantees; and</li>
            <li>leases not yet commenced to which the lessee is committed.</li>
        </ul>
    </li>
    <li>restrictions or covenants imposed by leases; and</li>
    <li>sale and leaseback transactions.</li>
</ul>
<p><b>Additional guidance is available in IFRS 16 B48 to B52</b></p>

    field1 => UTF-8 string (703) "Where necessary to meet the objective of providing users of the financial st...
    $value[83]['field1']
    Where necessary to meet the objective of providing users of the financial statements with sufficient information to assess the effect that leases have on the financial position, financial performance and cash flows of the lessor, has additional qualitative and quantitative information been disclosed?
<p>This may include the following: </p>
<ul>
    <li>the nature of the lessor’s leasing activities; and</li>
    <li>how the lessor manages the risk associated with any rights it retains in underlying assets. In particular, a lessor shall disclose its risk management strategy for the rights it retains in underlying assets, including any means by which the lessor reduces that risk.</li>
</ul>

    ⇄⧉
    field1 => string (1439) "All aspects of a service concession arrangement shall be considered in deter...
    $value[87]['field1']
    All aspects of a service concession arrangement shall be considered in determining the appropriate disclosures in the notes.
<p>An operator and a grantor shall disclose the following in each period: </p>
<ul>
    <li>a description of the arrangement;</li>
    <li>significant terms of the arrangement that may affect the amount, timing and certainty of future cash flows (e.g. the period of the concession, re-pricing dates and the basis upon which re-pricing or re-negotiation is determined);</li>
    <li>the nature and extent (e.g. quantity, time period or amount as appropriate) of: 
        <ul>
            <li>rights to use specified assets;</li>
            <li>obligations to provide, or rights to expect, provision of services;</li>
            <li>obligations to acquire or build items of property, plant and equipment;</li>
            <li>obligations to deliver or rights to receive specified assets at the end of the concession period;</li>
            <li>renewal and termination options; and</li>
            <li>other rights and obligations (e.g. major overhauls);</li>
        </ul>
    </li>
    <li>changes in the arrangement occurring during the period; and</li>
    <li>how the service arrangement has been classified?</li>
</ul>
<p>NB: These disclosures need to be provided individually for each service concession arrangement, or in aggregate for each class of service concession arrangements.</p>

    <b>Share Capital</b>
<p>It is necessary to understand the key terminology:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Authorised Share Capital = The maximum shares that a company can have;</li>
    <li>Issued Shares = The number of shares in existence;</li>
    <li>Allotted Shares = The number of shares allocated to shareholders;</li>
    <li>Called-Up Shares = Shares where payment has been requested;</li>
    <li>Paid-Up Shares = Payment has been received.</li>
</ul>

    field1 => string (839) "<b>Financial Instruments</b> <p>Disclosures relating to financial instrument...
    $value[111]['field1']
    <b>Financial Instruments</b>
<p>Disclosures relating to financial instruments affect receivables, payables, investments, bank and cash, and equity.  Rather than trying to lace these requirements into the specific Statement of Financial Position areas noted above and potentially having to repeat disclosures in this checklist on a number of occasions, the requirements of IFRS 7 <i>Financial Instruments: Disclosures</i> have been noted below.  </p>
<p>IFRS 9 <i>Financial Instruments</i> became mandatory for accounting periods commencing on/after 1 January 2018. Whilst IFRS 9 itself does not contain any disclosure requirements, it contains a number of changes to classification and measurement compared to IAS 39. </p>
<p>Reference should be made to Appendix B of IFRS 7 to assist with the disclosure requirements set out below.</p>

    field1 => string (1312) "If the entity has designated a financial asset (or group of financial assets...
    $value[115]['field1']
    If the entity has designated a financial asset (or group of financial assets) as measured at fair value through profit or loss that would otherwise be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income or amortised cost, have the following been disclosed:
<ul>
    <li>The maximum exposure to credit risk (see IFRS 7, paragraph 36 (a)) at the end of the reporting period;</li>
    <li>The amount by which any related credit derivatives or similar instruments mitigate that maximum exposure to credit risk;</li>
    <li>The amount of change, during the period and cumulatively, in the fair value that is attributable to changes in the credit risk of the financial asset determined either:
        <ul>
            <li>As the amount of change in its fair value that is not attributable to changes in market conditions that give rise to market risk; or</li>
            <li>Using an alternative method which the entity believes more faithfully represents the amount of change in its fair value that is attributable to changes in credit risk of the asset;</li>
        </ul>
    </li>
    <li>The amount of the change in the fair value of any related credit derivatives or similar instruments that has occurred during the period and cumulatively since the financial asset was designated?</li>
</ul>

    Where an entity has designated a financial liability as at fair value through profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9.4.2.2 and is required to present the effects of changes in that liability’s credit risk in other comprehensive income (see paragraph 5.7.7 of IFRS 9), have the following been disclosed:

    <li>Any transfers of the cumulative gain or loss within equity during the period including the reason for such transfers; and</li>
    <li>If a liability is derecognised during the period, the amount (if any) presented in other comprehensive income that was realised at derecognition?</li>
</ul>

    Has information been disclosed which allows the effect or potential effect of netting off arrangements on the entity’s financial position to be clear?
<p>To faciliate this, the following specific disclosures should be given, in tabular format (unless another format is more appropriate:</p>
<ol type="a">
    <li>The gross amount of those recognised financial assets and recognised financial liabilities;</li>
    <li>The amounts that are set-off in accordance with the criteria in IAS 32, paragraph 42 when determining the net amounts presented in the Statement of Financial Position;</li>
    <li>The net amounts presented;</li>
    <li>The amounts subject to an enforceable master netting arrangment or similar agreement that are not otherwise included in b, including:
        <ul>
            <li>Amounts related to recognised financial instruments that do not meet some or all of the offsetting criteria in IAS 32, paragraph 42; and</li>
            <li>Amounts related to financial collateral (including cash collateral);</li>
        </ul>
    </li>
    <li>The amount after deducting the amount in d from the amounts in c?</li>
</ol>
<p>The total amount disclosed in accordance with d. for an instrument shall be limited to the amount in c. for that instrument.</p>
<p>Regarding d the nature of those rights need to be disclosed. </p>
<p>If the information required to be disclosed by IFRS 7 13B to 13E is disclosed in more than one note, then a cross reference must be included.</p>

    field1 => string (1466) "Disclosure of fair values are <b><u>not</u></b> required in the following ci...
    $value[139]['field1']
    Disclosure of fair values are <b><u>not</u></b> required in the following circumstances:
<ol type="a">
    <li>When the carrying amount is a reasonable approximation of fair value, for example, for financial instruments such as short-term trade receivables and payables; or</li>
    <li>For a contract containing a discretionary participation feature (as described in IFRS 4), if the fair value of that feature cannot be measured reliably; or</li>
    <li>For lease liabilities.</li>
</ol>
<p>However, in the case of b above, have disclosures been given to allow readers of the financial statements to make their own judgements about the extext of possible differences between the carrying amount of those contracts and their fair value, including:</p>
<ul>
    <li>The fact that fair value information has not been disclosed for these instruments because their fair value cannot be measured reliably;</li>
    <li>A description of the financial instruments, their carrying amount, and an explanation of why fair value cannot be measured reliably;</li>
    <li>Information about the market for the instruments;</li>
    <li>Information about whether and how the entity intends to dispose of the financial instruments; and</li>
    <li>If financial instruments whose fair value previously could not be reliably measured are derecognised, that fact, their carrying amount at the time of derecognition, and the amount of gain or loss recognised?</li>
</ul>

    field1 => string (1134) "<b>Qualitative Disclosures</b> ~ <b><u>For each</u></b> type of risk arising...
    $value[142]['field1']
    <b>Qualitative Disclosures</b> ~ <b><u>For each</u></b> type of risk arising from financial instruments, have the following been disclosed:
<ol type="a">
    <li>Summary quantitiative data about its exposure to that risk at the end of the reporting period.  This shall be based on the information presented internally to key management; and</li>
    <li>The concentrations of risk, if not apparent from other disclosures made?</li>
</ol>
<p>Concentrations of risk arise from financial instruments that have similar characteristics and are affected similarly by changes in economic or other conditions. The identification of concentrations of risk requires judgement taking into account the circumstances of the entity. Disclosure of concentrations of risk shall include:</p>
<ul>
    <li>description of how management determines concentrations;</li>
    <li>a description of the shared characteristic that identifies each concentration (eg counterparty, geographical area, currency or market); and</li>
    <li>the amount of the risk exposure associated with all financial instruments sharing that characteristic.</li>
</ul>

    field1 => UTF-8 string (1302) "The disclosure requirements in IFRS 7 paragraphs 35F–35N shall be applied to...
    $value[144]['field1']
    The disclosure requirements in IFRS 7 paragraphs 35F–35N shall be applied to financial instruments to which the impairment requirements in IFRS 9 are applied. 
<p>These disclosures shall enable users of financial statements to understand the effect of credit risk on the amount, timing and uncertainty of future cash flows. To achieve this objective, have the following disclosures been provided:</p>
<ul>
    <li>information about an entity’s credit risk management practices and how they relate to the recognition and measurement of expected credit losses, including the methods, assumptions and information used to measure expected credit losses;</li>
    <li>quantitative and qualitative information that allows users of financial statements to evaluate the amounts in the financial statements arising from expected credit losses, including changes in the amount of expected credit losses and the reasons for those changes; and</li>
    <li>information about an entity’s credit risk exposure (ie the credit risk inherent in an entity’s financial assets and commitments to extend credit) including significant credit risk concentrations?</li>
</ul>
<p>NB: the entity need not duplicate information already presented elsewhere, provided that appropriate cross references are given.</p>

    field1 => UTF-8 string (2365) "Has an explantion been given of the entity’s credit risk management practice...
    $value[145]['field1']
    Has an explantion been given of the entity’s credit risk management practices and how they relate to the recognition and measurement of expected credit losses? 
<p>To meet this objective an entity shall disclose information that enables users of financial statements to understand and evaluate:</p>
<ol type="a">
    <li>how an entity determined whether the credit risk of financial instruments has increased significantly since initial recognition, including, if and how:
        <ol type="i">
            <li>financial instruments are considered to have low credit risk in accordance with paragraph 5.5.10 of IFRS 9, including the classes of financial instruments to which it applies; and</li>
            <li>the presumption in paragraph 5.5.11 of IFRS 9, that there have been significant increases in credit risk since initial recognition when financial assets are more than 30 days past due, has been rebutted;</li>
        </ol>
    </li>
    <li>an entity’s definitions of default, including the reasons for selecting those definitions;</li>
    <li>ow the instruments were grouped if expected credit losses were measured on a collective basis;</li>
    <li>how an entity determined that financial assets are credit-impaired financial assets;</li>
    <li>an entity’s write-off policy, including the indicators that there is no reasonable expectation of recovery and information about the policy for financial assets that are written-off but are still subject to enforcement activity; and</li>
    <li>how the requirements in paragraph 5.5.12 of IFRS 9 for the modification of contractual cash flows of financial assets have been applied, including how an entity:
        <ol type="i">
            <li>determines whether the credit risk on a financial asset that has been modified while the loss allowance was measured at an amount equal to lifetime expected credit losses, has improved to the extent that the loss allowance reverts to being measured at an amount equal to 12-month expected credit losses in accordance with paragraph 5.5.5 of IFRS 9; and</li>
            <li>monitors the extent to which the loss allowance on financial assets meeting the criteria in (i) is subsequently remeasured at an amount equal to lifetime expected credit losses in accordance with paragraph 5.5.3 of IFRS 9?</li>
        </ol>
    </li>
</ol>

    field1 => string (2274) "To explain the changes in the loss allowance and the reasons for those chang...
    $value[148]['field1']
    To explain the changes in the loss allowance and the reasons for those changes, has a reconciliation from the opening balance to the closing balance of the loss allowance been given <b><u>for each class of financial instrument</u></b>?
<p>This reconciliation should be presented as a table, showing separately the changes during the period for:</p>
<ol type="a">
    <li>the loss allowance measured at an amount equal to 12-month expected credit losses;</li>
    <li>the loss allowance measured at an amount equal to lifetime expected credit losses for:
        <ol type="i">
            <li>financial instruments for which credit risk has increased significantly since initial recognition but that are not credit-impaired financial assets;</li>
            <li>financial assets that are credit-impaired at the reporting date (but that are not purchased or originated credit-impaired); and</li>
            <li>trade receivables, contract assets or lease receivables for which the loss allowances are measured in accordance with paragraph 5.5.15 of IFRS 9.</li>
        </ol>
    </li>
    <li>financial assets that are purchased or originated credit-impaired. In addition to the reconciliation, an entity shall disclose the total amount of undiscounted expected credit losses at initial recognition on financial assets initially recognised during the reporting period.</li>
</ol>
<p><i>For loan commitments and financial guarantee contracts the loss allowance is recognised as a provision. An entity should disclose information about the changes in the loss allowance for financial assets separately from those for loan commitments and financial guarantee contracts. However, if a financial instrument includes both a loan (ie financial asset) and an undrawn commitment (ie loan commitment) component and the entity cannot separately identify the expected credit losses on the loan commitment component from those on the financial asset component, the expected credit losses on the loan commitment should be recognised together with the loss allowance for the financial asset. To the extent that the combined expected credit losses exceed the gross carrying amount of the financial asset, the expected credit losses should be recognised as a provision.</i></p>

    $value[149]['field1']
    To enable users of financial statements to understand the changes in the loss allowance disclosed in accordance with paragraph 35H, has an explanation been provided of how significant changes in the gross carrying amount of financial instruments during the period contributed to changes in the loss allowance?
<p><i>The information shall be provided separately for financial instruments that represent the loss allowance as listed in paragraph 35H(a)–(c) and shall include relevant qualitative and quantitative information.</i></p>
<p><i>Examples of changes in the gross carrying amount of financial instruments that contributed to the changes in the loss allowance may include:</i></p>
<ul>
    <li><i>changes because of financial instruments originated or acquired during the reporting period;</i></li>
    <li><i>the modification of contractual cash flows on financial assets that do not result in a derecognition of those financial assets in accordance with IFRS 9;</i></li>
    <li><i>changes because of financial instruments that were derecognised (including those that were written-off) during the reporting period; and</i></li>
    <li><i>changes arising from whether the loss allowance is measured at an amount equal to 12-month or lifetime expected credit losses.</i></li>
</ul>

    To enable users of financial statements to understand the nature and effect of modifications of contractual cash flows on financial assets that have not resulted in derecognition and the effect of such modifications on the measurement of expected credit losses, has the following been disclosed:

    Have disclosures been given to enable users of financial statements to assess an entity’s credit risk exposure and understand its significant credit risk concentrations, by credit risk rating grades, the gross carrying amount of financial assets and the exposure to credit risk on loan commitments and financial guarantee contracts?
<p>This information shall be provided separately for financial instruments:</p>
<ol type="a">
    <li>for which the loss allowance is measured at an amount equal to 12-month expected credit losses;</li>
    <li>for which the loss allowance is measured at an amount equal to lifetime expected credit losses and that are:
        <ol type="i">
            <li>financial instruments for which credit risk has increased significantly since initial recognition but that are not credit-impaired financial assets;</li>
            <li>financial assets that are credit-impaired at the reporting date (but that are not purchased or originated credit-impaired); and</li>
            <li>trade receivables, contract assets or lease receivables for which the loss allowances are measured in accordance with paragraph 5.5.15 of IFRS 9.</li>
        </ol>
    </li>
    <li>hat are purchased or originated credit-impaired financial assets.</li>
</ol>
<p><i>NB: For trade receivables, contract assets and lease receivables to which an entity applies paragraph 5.5.15 of IFRS 9, the information provided here may be based on a provision matrix (see paragraph B5.5.35 of IFRS 9).</i></p>

    Liquidity Risk 
<p>Have the following been disclosed:</p>
<ol type="a">
    <li>A maturity analysis for non-derivative financial liabilities (including issued financial guarantee contracts) that show the remaining contractual maturities;</li>
    <li>A maturity analysis for derivative financial liabilities.  The maturity analysis shall include the remaining contractual maturities for those derivatives’ financial liabilities for which contractual maturities are essential for an understanding of the timing of the cash flows; and</li>
    <li>A description of how the entity manages risk inherent in a and b?</li>
</ol>
<p><i>The entity should disclose a maturity analysis of financial assets it holds for managing liquidity risk (eg financial assets that are readily saleable or expected to generate cash inflows to meet cash outflows on financial liabilities), if that information is necessary to enable users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature and extent of liquidity risk.</i></p>
<p><i><b>See also IFRS 7 B.11F</b></i></p>

    <li>The method and assumptions used in preparing the sensitivity analysis, and </li>
    <li>Changes from the previous period in the methods and assumptions used, and reasons for those changes?</li>
</ul>

    field1 => UTF-8 string (767) "<b>Transfers of Financial Assets</b> <p>The disclosure requirements of IFRS ...
    $value[161]['field1']
    <b>Transfers of Financial Assets</b>
<p>The disclosure requirements of IFRS 7, paragraph 42B – 42H relate to all transferred financial assets that are not derecognised and for any continuing involvment in a transferred asset that existed as the reporting date.  For the purpose of applying the disclosure requirements in those paragraphs, an entity transfers all or a part of a financial asset (the transferred financial asset) if, and only if, it either:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Transfers the contractual rights to receive the cash flows of that financial asset; or </li>
    <li>Retains the contractual rights to receive the cash flows of that asset, but assumes a contractual obligation to pay the cash flows to one or more recipients in an arrangement.</li>
</ul>

    field1 => UTF-8 string (1259) "To meet the requirements of IFRS 7, paragraph 42B(a), have the following bee...
    $value[163]['field1']
    To meet the requirements of IFRS 7, paragraph 42B(a), have the following been disclosed:
<ul>
    <li>The nature of the transferred asset;</li>
    <li>The nature of the risks and rewards of ownership to which the entity is exposed;</li>
    <li>A description of the nature of the relationship between the transferred assets and the associated liabilities, including restrictions arising from the transfer on the reporting entity’s use of the transferred assets;</li>
    <li>When the counterparty (counterparties) to the associated liabilities has (have) recourse only to the transferred assets, a schedule that sets out the fair value of the transferred assets, the fair value of the associated liabilities and the net position;</li>
    <li>When the entity continues to recognise all of the transferred asset, the carrying amount of the transferred asset and the associated liability;</li>
    <li>When the entity continues to recognise the assets to the extent of its continuing involvement (see IAS 39,  paragraph 20 (c) (ii) and 30), the total carrying amount of the original assets before the transfer, the carrying amount of the assets that the entity continues to recognise, and the carrying amount of the associated liabilities?</li>
</ul>

    field1 => UTF-8 string (1864) "To meet the requirements of IFRS 7, paragraph 42B (b) above, have the follow...
    $value[164]['field1']
    To meet the requirements of IFRS 7, paragraph 42B (b) above, have the following been disclosed:
<ol type="a">
    <li>The carrying amount of the assets and liabilities that are recognized in the entity’s Statement of Financial Position and represents the entity’s continuing involvement in the derecognised financial assets, and the line items in which the carrying amount of those assets and liabilities are recognised;</li>
    <li>The fair value of the assets and liabilities that represent the entity’s continuing involvement in the derecognised financial assets;</li>
    <li>The amount that best represents the entity’s maximum exposure to loss from its continuing involvement in the derecognised financial asset, and information showing how the maximum exposure to loss is determined;</li>
    <li>The undiscounted cash outflows that would or may be required to repurchase derecognised financial assets (e.g. the strike price in an option agreement) or other amounts payable to the transferee in respect of the transferred assets.  If the cash outflow is variable then the amount disclosed should be based on the conditions that exist at each reporting date;</li>
    <li>A maturity analysis of the undiscounted cash outflows that would or maybe required to repurchase the derecognised financial assets or other amounts payable to the transferee in respect of the transferred assets, showing the remaining contractual maturities of the entity’s continuing involvement; and</li>
    <li>Qualitative information that explains and supports the quantitative disclosures required by a to e above?</li>
</ol>
<p>The above information maybe aggregated in respect of particular assets if the entity has more than one type of continuing involvement in that derecognised financial asset, and reports it under one type of continuing involvement.</p>

    field1 => UTF-8 string (1963) "<b>Hedge Accounting</b> <p>An entity shall apply the disclosure requirements...
    $value[166]['field1']
    <b>Hedge Accounting</b>
<p>An entity shall apply the disclosure requirements in paragraphs 21B–24F of IFRS 7 for those risk exposures that an entity hedges and for which it elects to apply hedge accounting. Hedge accounting disclosures shall provide information about:</p>
<ol type="a">
    <li>an entity’s risk management strategy and how it is applied to manage risk;</li>
    <li>how the entity’s hedging activities may affect the amount, timing and uncertainty of its future cash flows; and</li>
    <li>the effect that hedge accounting has had on the entity’s statement of financial position, statement of comprehensive income and statement of changes in equity.</li>
</ol>
<p>An entity shall present the required disclosures in a single note or separate section in its financial statements. However, an entity need not duplicate information that is already presented elsewhere, provided that the information is incorporated by cross-reference from the financial statements to some other statement. </p>
<p>When paragraphs 22A–24F require the entity to separate by risk category the information disclosed, the entity shall determine each risk category on the basis of the risk exposures an entity decides to hedge and for which hedge accounting is applied. An entity shall determine risk categories consistently for all hedge accounting disclosures</p>
<p>To meet the objectives in paragraph 21A, an entity shall (except as otherwise specified below) determine how much detail to disclose, how much emphasis to place on different aspects of the disclosure requirements, the appropriate level of aggregation or disaggregation, and whether users of financial statements need additional explanations to evaluate the quantitative information disclosed. However, an entity shall use the same level of aggregation or disaggregation it uses for disclosure requirements of related information in this IFRS and IFRS 13 Fair Value Measurement.</p>

    field1 => string (1084) "Has an explanation been given of the risk management strategy for each risk ...
    $value[168]['field1']
    Has an explanation been given of the risk management strategy for each risk category of risk exposures that it decides to hedge and for which hedge accounting is applied?
<p>This explanation should enable users of financial statements to evaluate (for example):</p>
<ol type="a">
    <li>how each risk arises.</li>
    <li>how the entity manages each risk; this includes whether the entity hedges an item in its entirety for all risks or hedges a risk component (or components) of an item and why.</li>
    <li>the extent of risk exposures that the entity manages.</li>
</ol>
<p>To meet these requirements, the information should include (but is not limited to) a description of:</p>
<ul>
    <li>the hedging instruments  that are used (and how they are used) to hedge risk exposures;</li>
    <li>how the entity determines the economic relationship between the hedged item and the hedging instrument for the purpose of assessing hedge effectiveness; and</li>
    <li>how the entity establishes the hedge ratio and what the sources of hedge ineffectiveness are.</li>
</ul>

    field1 => UTF-8 string (1157) "Where an entity frequently resets (ie discontinues and restarts) hedging rel...
    $value[171]['field1']
    Where an entity frequently resets (ie discontinues and restarts) hedging relationships because both the hedging instrument and the hedged item frequently change (see the example in paragraph B6.5.24(b) of IFRS 9) the entity is exempt from providing the disclosures required by paragraphs 23A and 23B.
<p>Instead, have the following been disclosed:</p>
<ul>
    <li>information about what the ultimate risk management strategy is in relation to those hedging relationships;</li>
    <li>a description of how it reflects its risk management strategy by using hedge accounting and designating those particular hedging relationships; and</li>
    <li>an indication of how frequently the hedging relationships are discontinued and restarted as part of the entity’s process in relation to those hedging relationships?</li>
</ul>
<p><i>When the volume of hedging relationships to which this exemption applies is unrepresentative of normal volumes during the period (ie the volume at the reporting date does not reflect the volumes during the period) an entity shall disclose that fact and the reason it believes the volumes are unrepresentative.</i></p>

    <li>the line item in the statement of comprehensive income that includes the recognised hedge ineffectiveness?</li>
</ol>

    For cash flow hedges and hedges of a net investment in a foreign operation, has the entity disclosed, in a tabular format, the following amounts separately by risk category:
<ol type="i">
    <li>the change in value of the hedged item used as the basis for recognising hedge ineffectiveness for the period (ie for cash flow hedges the change in value used to determine the recognised hedge ineffectiveness in accordance with paragraph 6.5.11(c) of IFRS 9);</li>

    <li>the balances remaining in the cash flow hedge reserve and the foreign currency translation reserve from any hedging relationships for which hedge accounting is no longer applied;</li>
    <li>hedging gains or losses of the reporting period that were recognised in other comprehensive income;</li>
    <li>hedge ineffectiveness recognised in profit or loss;</li>
    <li>the line item in the statement of comprehensive income that includes the recognised hedge ineffectiveness;</li>
    <li>the amount reclassified from the cash flow hedge reserve or the foreign currency translation reserve into profit or loss as a reclassification adjustment (see IAS 1) (differentiating between amounts for which hedge accounting had previously been used, but for which the hedged future cash flows are no longer expected to occur, and amounts that have been transferred because the hedged item has affected profit or loss);</li>
    <li>the line item in the statement of comprehensive income that includes the reclassification adjustment (see IAS 1); and</li>
    <li>for hedges of net positions, the hedging gains or losses recognised in a separate line item in the statement of comprehensive income (see paragraph 6.6.4 of IFRS 9)?</li>
</ol>

    field1 => UTF-8 string (4974) "For each class of asset and liablity (determined in accordance with IFRS 13,...
    $value[184]['field1']
    For each class of asset and liablity (determined in accordance with IFRS 13, paragraph 94) measured at fair value in the Statement of Financial Position after initial recognition, are the following disclosed?
<ol type="a">
    <li>For recurring and non-recurring fair value measurements at the end of the reporting period, and non-recurring fair value measurements, the reason for the measurement;</li>
    <li>For recurring and non-recurring fair value measurements; the level of the fair value hierarchy within which the fair value measurements are categorised in their entirety (e.g, Level 1,2,3);</li>
    <li>For assets and liabilities held at the end of the reporting period that are measured at fair value on a recurring basis, the amount transferred between Level 1 and Level 2, the reason for those transfers and the policy for determining when transfers between levels occurred (transfers into a level should be discussed separately from transfer out of a level); a description of the valuation technique(s) and inputs used in the fair value measurement and if there has been a change in valuation technique, has this been disclosed along with the reason for the change;</li>
    <li>For fair value measurements categorised within Level 3, have quantitative information about the significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurements been discussed (this information does not need to be ‘artificially’ created when an entity uses prices from prior transactions or third-party pricing information without adjustment, however, quantitative unobservable inputs that are significant to the fair value measurement and are reasonably available cannot be ignored);</li>
    <li>For fair value measurements categorised within Level 3, have quantitative information about the significant unobservable inputs used in fair value measurements been discussed (this information does not need to be ‘artificially’ created when an entity uses prices from prior transactions or third-party pricing information without adjustment, however, quantitative unobservable inputs that are significant to the fair value measurement and are reasonably available cannot be ignored);</li>
    <li>For recurring fair value measurements categorised within Level 3, a reconciliation from the opening balances to the closing balances, disclosing separately:
        <ol type="1">
            <li>) Total gains and losses for the period recognised in profit or loss, and the line item(s) in profit or loss in which those gains and losses are recognised;</li>
            <li>) Total gains or losses for the period recognised in OCI, and the line item(s) in which those gains or losses are recognised;</li>
            <li>) Purchase;</li>
            <li>) Sales;</li>
            <li>) Issues;</li>
            <li>) Settlements;</li>
            <li>) Transfers into Level 3; and</li>
            <li>) Transfers out of Level 3.</li>
        </ol>
    </li>
    <li>For recurring fair value measurements categorised within Level 3, the amount of the gain or loss for the period in (e)(1) included in profit or loss that is attributable to the change in unrealised gains or losses relating to those assets and liabilities held at the reporting period, and the line item(s) in profit or loss in which those unrealised gains or losses are recognised.</li>
    <li>For non-recurring fair value measurements categorised within Level 3, a description of the valuation processes used by the entity;</li>
    <li>For recurring and non-recurring fair value measurements categorised within Level 3, a description are the following disclosed:-
        <ul>
            <li>For all such measurements, a narrative description of the sensitivity of fair value measurements to changes in unobservable inputs, if a change in those inputs to a different amount might result in a significantly higher or lower fair value measurement.  If there are interrelationships between those inputs and other unobservable inputs in the fair value measurement, a description of those interrelationships and how they might magnify or mitigate the effect of changes in the unobservable inputs on the fair value measurement;</li>
            <li>For financial assets and financial liabilities, if changing one or more of the unobservable inputs to reflect reasonably possible alternative assumptions would change fair value significantly, is this fact disclosed, the effect of those changes and how the effect of the changes was calculated</li>
        </ul>
    </li>
    <li>For recurring and non-recurring fair value measurements, if the highest and best use of a non-financial asset differs from its current use, has this been disclosed and why the non-financial asset is being used in a manner that differs from its highest and best use?</li>
</ol>
<p>NB: Any analysis given above should either agree or be reconcilied to a line item in the Statement of Financial Position.</p>
